Explanation: The doctor suggested an X-ray of the right knee to assess for fractures or bony abnormalities, which aligns with the similar justification provided.
The doctor suggested an MRI of the right knee to evaluate soft tissues, which aligns with the similar justification provided.
The doctor did not suggest an ultrasound of the right knee, which would have been relevant for assessing effusion or soft tissue abnormalities.
The doctor suggested blood tests to rule out underlying medical conditions, which aligns with the justification of ruling out inflammatory or infectious processes contributing to knee pain.
